Package tachyon.worker

Worker process and utils for working with the worker remotely.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DataServer
    Defines how to interact with a server running the data protocol.
    Worker
    Interface of a Tachyon worker.
    WorkerFactory
    Interface for factory of Worker.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ClientMetrics
    ClientMetrics is used to pass client metrics from client to worker by session heartbeat.
    DataServer.Factory
    Factory for DataServer.
    DataServerMessage
    The message type used to send data request and response for remote data.
    NetAddress
    The network address of a worker.
    TachyonWorker
    Entry point for the Tachyon Worker.
    WorkerBase
    This is the base class for all workers, and contains common functionality.
    WorkerContext
    A WorkerContext object stores TachyonConf.
    WorkerIdRegistry
    The single place to get, set, and update worker id.
    WorkerSource
    A WorkerSource collects a Worker's internal state.

Package tachyon.worker Description

Worker process and utils for working with the worker remotely. Main entry point for the worker is TachyonWorker.main(String[]) which gets started by the tachyon start scripts. The TachyonWorker class spins up the different RPC services (thrift, data) which are mostly wrappers around BlockDataManager.

Services

Thrift

The thrift service is mostly responsible for metadata operations (with a few operations that effect the worker's cached memory).

Cache Block

Move's user generated blocks to the tachyon data directory. This operation expects that the caller is a local (to the node) caller, and that the input are under the user directories. Implementation can be found at BlockDataManager.commitBlock(long, long)

Lock / Unlock

Tachyon supports caching blocks to local disk (client side). When this happens, a lock is given to the client to protect it from the remote block changing. Implementation can be found at BlockDataManager.lockBlock(long, long) and BlockDataManager.unlockBlock(long, long).

Data

This service is the main interaction between users and reading blocks. Currently this service only supports reading blocks (writing is to local disk). There are two different implementations of this layer: NettyDataServer and NIODataServer; netty is the default. To support both, a DataServer interface is used that just defines how to start/stop, and get port details; to start, object init is used. The current read protocol is defined in DataServerMessage. This has two different types: read DataServerMessage.createBlockRequestMessage() and write DataServerMessage.createBlockResponseMessage(boolean, long, java.nio.ByteBuffer). Side note, the netty implementation does not use this class, but has defined two classes for the read and write case: RPCBlockReadRequest, RPCBlockReadResponse; theses classes are network compatible.
